fr.lri.swingstates.sm.jtransitions

Class ClickOnComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.lri.swingstates.sm.Transition
      • fr.lri.swingstates.sm.transitions.Event
        • fr.lri.swingstates.sm.transitions.EventOnPosition
          • fr.lri.swingstates.sm.EventOnComponent
            • fr.lri.swingstates.sm.jtransitions.MouseOnComponent
              • fr.lri.swingstates.sm.jtransitions.ClickOnComponent

  • public class ClickOnComponent
extends MouseOnComponent
    A transition triggered by a mouse button clicked on a JComponent. A click is defined as a quick succession of mouse press and mouse release, without significant motion in between. Note that the mouse press and mouse release events are always sent, even when a mouse click event is sent.
    Author:
    Caroline Appert

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClickOnComponent(int button)
      Builds a transition triggered by a mouse clicked event with any modifier on a component that loops on the current state.

      Builds a transition triggered by a mouse clicked event on a component.
      ClickOnComponent(int button, java.lang.String outState)
      Builds a transition triggered by a mouse clicked event with any modifier on a component.
